prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Within this coordinate system, create the first sketch. On face 1, create loop 1, which consists of: - line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.0] - line 2: Starting at [0.5, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.75] - line 3: Starting at [0.5, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] - line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] This completes the 2D sketch. Next, scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.3 units to create the first 3D model. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.3], which aligns it with the top surface of Part 1. Within this coordinate system, create the second sketch. On face 1, create loop 1, which consists of: - line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.15, 0.0] - line 2: Starting at [0.15, 0.0] and ending at [0.15, 0.75] - line 3: Starting at [0.15, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] - line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] This completes the 2D sketch. Next, scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier in the coordinate system. Perform a cut operation using the extrusion tool with no depth towards the normal and 0.15 units towards the opposite direction of the normal. Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.225, 0.275, 0.3], which aligns it with the top-right corner of Part 2. Within this coordinate system, create the third sketch. On face 1, create loop 1, which consists of: - circle 1: Centered at [0.1, 0.1] with a radius of 0.1 This completes the 2D sketch. Next, scale the 2D sketch by 0.2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier in the coordinate system. Perform a cut operation using the extrusion tool with no depth towards the normal and 1.25 units towards the opposite direction of the normal to complete the object as a cylindrical object with a tapered end.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by drawing a 2D sketch on face_1 of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw the following lines to form a rectangle: - Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.7016, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.7016, 0.0], End Point: [0.7016, 0.1694] - Line 3: Start Point: [0.7016, 0.1694], End Point: [0.0, 0.1694] - Line 4: Start Point: [0.0, 0.1694], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] This completes loop_1, consisting of 4 linear curves. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.7016. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.1694 units. Part 2: Construction of a Cylinder Pair Construct a CAD model consisting of nine different camera views of two cylinders, one slightly taller than the other, positioned side by side. 1. Begin by drawing a 2D sketch on face_1 of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw a second 2D sketch on face_2 of the same coordinate system. 5. Draw a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.0157, 0.0883] - Radius: 0.0157 This completes loop_1 on face_2, consisting of 1 circular curve. 6. Scale the 2D sketches by 0.104. 7. Transform both scaled 2D sketches into 3D Sketches using the given euler angles and translation vector. 8. Extrude both 2D sketches along the normal direction by a depth of 0.0484 units. The two parts are then combined using the join operation. The resulting CAD model is the combination of the two extrusions, positioned side by side based on the given euler angles and translation vector.</description>
